intro: Microstylis mambulilingensis, commonly known as the Philippine microstylis, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowering structures. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
